page.title: 06MURTON COLLIERY BAND
page.content: Brass bands are a major part of mining heritage.Murton has always been a mining community,so it is natural that our village has a brass band.It was founded originally as the "Gospel Temperance Blue Ribbon Army Band"in 1884.An unwise choice of title led to the change to "Murton Colliery Brass Band" one year later.It has been known by this title ever since.Members of mining familes have served in the band over the years,often fathers passing on the tradition to sons,or maybe,as recently,to daughters.Todaythere are 23 members,21 men and 2 women.About one third of the members have mining connections.One important annual event in the bands calender in July is when the band accompanied the Colliery Banner to the Miners Gala in nearby Durham.Last year Murtons band was one of those to play in the service in
